text.0: as twere the name of father easy to invoke we all assembled here invoke this car of yours.
text.1: aśvins your swiftlyrolling circumambient car which he who worships must invoke at eve and dawn.
text.2: awake all pleasant strains and let the hymns flow forth raise up abundant fulness this is our desire.
text.3: aśvins bestow on us a glorious heritage and give our princes treasure fair as soma is.
text.4: ye are the bliss of her who groweth old at home and helpers of the slow although he linger last.
text.5: men call you too nāsatyas healers of the blind the thin and feeble and the man with broken bones.
text.6: ye made cyavāna weak and worn with length of days young again like a car that he had power to move.
text.7: ye lifted up the son of tugra from the floods at our libations must all these your acts be praised.
text.8: we will declare among the folk your ancient deeds heroic yea ye were physicians bringing health.
text.9: you you who must be lauded will we bring for aid so that this foe of ours o aśvins may believe.
text.10: listen to me o aśvins i have cried to you give meyour aid as sire and mother aid their son.
text.11: poor without kin or friend or ties of blood am i save me before it be too late from this my curse.
text.12: ye mounted on your chariot brought to vimada the comely maid of purumitra as a bride.
text.13: ye came unto the calling of the weaklings dame and granted noble offspring to the happy wife.
text.14: ye gave a ain the vigour of his youthful life to tge sage kali when old age was coming nigh.
text.15: ye rescued vandana and raised him from the pit and in a moment gave viśpalā power to move.
text.16: ye aśvins twain endowed with manly strength brought forth reblia when hidden in the cave and wellnigh dead.
text.17: freed saptavadliri and for atri caused the pit heated with fire to be a pleasant restingplace.
text.18: on pedu ye bestowed aśvins a courser white mighty with nineandninety varied gifts of strength.
text.19: a horse to be renowned who bore his friend at speed joygiving bhagalike to be invoked of men.
text.20: from no side ye two kings whom none may check or stay doth grief distress or danger come u on the man.
text.21: whom aśvins swift to hear borne on your glowing path ye with your consort make the foremost in the race.
text.22: come on that chariot which the Ṛbhus wrought for you the chariot aśvins that is speedier than thought.
text.23: at harnessing whereof heavens daughter springs to birth and from vivasvān come auspicious night and day.
text.24: come conquerors of the sundered mountain to our home aśvins who made the cow stream milk for Śayus sake.
text.25: ye who delivered even from the wolfs deep throat and set again at liberty the swallowed quail.
text.26: we have prepared this laud for you o aśvins and like the bhṛgus as a car have framed it.
text.27: have decked it as a maid to meet the bridegroom and brought it as a son our stay for ever.
